summary: JeecgBoot vulnerable to SQL injection in queryTableDictItemsByCode
details:
A vulnerability classified as critical was found in [JeecgBoot up to 3.5.1](https://vuldb.com/?product.jeecgboot). Affected by this vulnerability is the function queryTableDictItemsByCode. The manipulation with an unknown input leads to a sql injection vulnerability. The CWE definition for the vulnerability is [CWE-89](https://vuldb.com/?vulnerability_cwe.231895). The software constructs all or part of an SQL command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended SQL command when it is sent to a downstream component. As an impact it is known to affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The summary by CVE is:

The weakness was published 06/19/2023 as 4983. It is possible to read the advisory at [github.com](https://vuldb.com/?advisory_url.231895). This vulnerability is known as [CVE-2023-34602](https://vuldb.com/?source_cve.231895) since 06/07/2023. Technical details of the vulnerability are known, but there is no available exploit. The attack technique deployed by this issue is [T1505](https://vuldb.com/?vulnerability_attck.231895) according to MITRE ATT&CK.

There is no information about possible countermeasures known. It may be suggested to replace the affected object with an alternative product.
